meanings.sent1: She is reapplying for the job after improving her skills.
meanings.sent2: I will be reapplying sunscreen every two hours at the beach.
meanings.sent3: He kept reapplying the same bandage, hoping it would magically heal faster.

meanings.definition: To put on or spread again
meanings.sent1: The painter is reapplying a fresh coat of paint to the walls.
meanings.sent2: Remember to reapply the insect repellent after swimming.
meanings.sent3: She kept reapplying glitter to her nails, making them sparkle even more.
meanings.sent4: Reapplying makeup can give you a fresh and polished look.
meanings.sent5: Reapplying the protective wax layer on the car keeps it shiny and protected.

meanings.definition: To make a new application or request
meanings.sent1: He will be reapplying for a loan at the bank next week.
meanings.sent2: After the rejection, she decided to reapply for the scholarship.
meanings.sent3: Reapplying for the same grant felt like a deja vu moment.
meanings.sent4: She thought of reapplying for the job as a chance for redemption.
meanings.sent5: Reapplying for the permit was a tedious process, but necessary for legality.
